title: Introductions and Workplace Greetings
objective: Learn to introduce yourself and greet others in professional and technical environments.
examples: Hello, I’m a student at the technical high school.
Nice to meet you, I’m the supervisor.
learningOutcome: By the end of this topic, students will be able to introduce yourself and greet others in professional and technical environments.

title: Describing Your Technical Specialty
objective: Talk about your technical field, your role, and your training.
examples: We learn how to fix machines.
learningOutcome: By the end of this topic, students will be able to talk about your technical field, your role, and your training.

title: Asking and Giving Directions in the Workplace
objective: Understand and give directions within a technical facility or company.
examples: Go straight and turn right at the lab.
learningOutcome: By the end of this topic, students will be able to understand and give directions within a technical facility or company.

title: Tools and Equipment
objective: Identify and describe common tools and equipment used in your technical area.
examples: We use a welding machine in metalwork.
learningOutcome: By the end of this topic, students will be able to identify and describe common tools and equipment used in your technical area.

title: Workplace Instructions and Commands
objective: Understand and follow basic spoken and written workplace instructions.
learningOutcome: By the end of this topic, students will be able to understand and follow basic spoken and written workplace instructions.

title: Workplace Safety and Signs
objective: Recognize safety vocabulary, signs and rules in technical environments.
examples: Wear your helmet at all times.
learningOutcome: By the end of this topic, students will be able to recognize safety vocabulary, signs and rules in technical environments.

title: Describing Daily Routines
objective: Explain your daily activities and tasks at the workshop or internship.
examples: I check the system every morning.
We clean the tools before leaving.
learningOutcome: By the end of this topic, students will be able to explain your daily activities and tasks at the workshop or internship.

title: Reporting Problems and Malfunctions
objective: Learn to explain technical issues or report problems to supervisors.
examples: There is a leak in the pipe.
learningOutcome: By the end of this topic, students will be able to explain technical issues or report problems to supervisors.

title: Technical Vocabulary for Processes
objective: Learn vocabulary and verbs related to processes in technical areas.
examples: We measure, cut and weld the pieces.
The process includes heating and cooling.
learningOutcome: By the end of this topic, students will be able to learn vocabulary and verbs related to processes in technical areas.

title: Using the Simple Present for Descriptions
objective: Use the present tense to describe roles, materials, and actions in your field.
learningOutcome: By the end of this topic, students will be able to use the present tense to describe roles, materials, and actions in your field.

title: Scheduling and Appointments
objective: Learn how to talk about time, appointments, and work schedules.
learningOutcome: By the end of this topic, students will be able to learn how to talk about time, appointments, and work schedules.

title: Telephone and Email Communication
objective: Use appropriate language for simple phone calls and emails in a work context.
examples: Can I speak to Mr. López?
learningOutcome: By the end of this topic, students will be able to use appropriate language for simple phone calls and emails in a work context.

title: Describing Materials and Quantities
objective: Talk about types of materials, measurements, and quantities in technical tasks.
learningOutcome: By the end of this topic, students will be able to talk about types of materials, measurements, and quantities in technical tasks.

title: Giving and Receiving Feedback
objective: Learn expressions for giving suggestions, receiving feedback, and correcting errors.
examples: You should tighten the screw more.
learningOutcome: By the end of this topic, students will be able to learn expressions for giving suggestions, receiving feedback, and correcting errors.

title: Writing Short Technical Reports
objective: Practice writing short, structured reports about simple tasks or observations.
examples: We completed the maintenance on July 3rd.
The machine was tested and passed.
learningOutcome: By the end of this topic, students will be able to practice writing short, structured reports about simple tasks or observations.

title: Workplace Values and Attitudes
objective: Discuss attitudes like responsibility, punctuality, and teamwork in the workplace.
learningOutcome: By the end of this topic, students will be able to discuss attitudes like responsibility, punctuality, and teamwork in the workplace.

title: Customer Service Basics
objective: Practice basic expressions and etiquette for attending clients or users.
learningOutcome: By the end of this topic, students will be able to practice basic expressions and etiquette for attending clients or users.

title: Understanding Manuals and Diagrams
objective: Read and understand basic technical manuals, diagrams and symbols.
examples: See the installation diagram on page 5.
The manual says to use low voltage.
learningOutcome: By the end of this topic, students will be able to read and understand basic technical manuals, diagrams and symbols.

title: Job Interviews and CV Vocabulary
objective: Learn common phrases and vocabulary for job applications and interviews.
learningOutcome: By the end of this topic, students will be able to learn common phrases and vocabulary for job applications and interviews.

title: Final Technical Simulation
objective: Apply all learned vocabulary and structures in a practical scenario (roleplay or simulation).
examples: Student A is a client, Student B is the technician.
Complete a service report and give feedback.
learningOutcome: By the end of this topic, students will be able to apply all learned vocabulary and structures in a practical scenario (roleplay or simulation).
